BLOGENTRY.TITLE: Time to get started!
BLOGENTRY.MESSAGE: Decided I need to get serious about creating a real web application from scratch using current technologies and methods. I have been leaning towards doing a food based web site for awhile. I’m pretty good at classic ASP and I know my way around databases and HTML, but I need to move in to the .NET world a bit more and I think now’s the time to start using real development tools (I have created entire web sites in notepad!).

BLOGENTRY.TITLE: 1st Version of Specs
Looking for a Web Address
Decide on web addresses
BLOGENTRY.MESSAGE: Glad2Cook.com and GladToCook.com - I think they are obviously the best of what is available.

BLOGENTRY.TITLE: Changing Course Already
I finally have a home
BLOGENTRY.MESSAGE: I setup jasonbutler.com (which I’ve had parked for years) to use as a development website – and to run this blog. I went with DiscountASP.net for my hosting company. They seem to be the best ASP.NET site for the money ($60 for a year with coupon). Changing DNS settings at NetworkSoultions.com to point to the new host worked fine.

BLOGENTRY.TITLE: Too late cyber-squatters!
BLOGENTRY.MESSAGE: Purchased domains gald2cook.com and gladtocook.com from Yahoo! ($9.95 each). Process went well and Yahoo’s services seem good for the price (Network Solutions is $35! and I’ve heard GoDaddy.com is not so great on customer support).

BLOGENTRY.TITLE: D'oh!
BLOGENTRY.MESSAGE: OK, so I’m and idiot. I went ahead and purchased glad2cook.com via Yahoo.

BLOGENTRY.TITLE: Logo brainstorming
Trying to setup a development environment
Bookmarks of ASP.NET and related topics
ASP.NET books
ASP.NET 1.1 vs 2.0
Deleting my test Web Application
Ordered 6 ASP books from Amazon
My Productivity has Doubled
BLOGENTRY.MESSAGE: I hooked up the {a href="http://www.microcenter.com/single_product_results.phtml?product_id=0219493 "}KVM switch{/a} and the {a href=" http://www.microcenter.com/single_product_results.phtml?product_id=0203017"} PS2 to USB cable{/a} that I bought yesterday to my laptop (where I’m developing G2C) and to my work computer (where I spend 8+ hours a day) with no problems. I highly recommend this setup to anyone who might be in a similar situation ;)

BLOGENTRY.TITLE: Finished cleaning up old test VS project
BLOGENTRY.MESSAGE: Cleaned up old test VS project from the laptop. Had to delete it in 3 places: VS folder under My Docs, interpub folder and IIS (seems like a lot to delete).

BLOGENTRY.TITLE: I can’t believe I’m creating a Blog (yes this one)
Fun with XML
BLOGENTRY.MESSAGE: Had several breakthroughs with reading a XML file into my ASP.NET code. Including using a DataList with Paging (not a built in function).

BLOGENTRY.TITLE: RSS <> XML
BLOGENTRY.MESSAGE: I researched the RSS protocol, it is only really for simple syndication (hence the name). I can’t use one RSS compliant XML file for syndication and my actual data repository like I planned to (I didn’t really see anyone on the web trying to do this - it is simply not a good idea). Decide to store data as a user defined XML file and create an on the fly RSS file (via code).

BLOGENTRY.TITLE: Creating a RSS services from ASP.NET code
Headers and Footers
Using CSS
Storing html tags in XML
Books from Amazon arrived
BLOGENTRY.MESSAGE: 5 of my 6 books from Amazon arrived today – yippee! Don’t know when I thought I was going to read them all. {BR}{BR} It’s odd that the one book that did not ship ({a href=" http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/0201760398/sr=8-2/qid=1146515963/ref=pd_bbs_2/103-9388996-2206262?%5Fencoding=UTF8 "}Essential ASP.NET with Examples in VB{/a}) was $20 when I ordered it, and it is now listed at $50! I bet they are hoping I’ll cancel my order on it - not a chance, I will wait years, I’ll wait until the book is obsolete, then I wait some more.

BLOGENTRY.TITLE: Adding a new page to the project
Easily read the first record in a DataView
Use your XML schema
Just write to the damn file!
Oh yeah… the reboot
XML Dates - tricky stuff
Aggressive Request Validation
Validator control tip
Having formatting issues with non-IE browsers?
Reading one XML record
BLOGENTRY.MESSAGE: I created a Blog Entry page (for just reading one entry referenced by Blog Number). I tried to set the page up with a Find command in a DataView, but I had problems getting the results to display directly in the HTML (not even with a Literal). So I used a DataList, not exactly my first guess for one entry, but it works great. It keeps the formatting intact, handles filters just fine, and it is even easy to use with a row return of 0.
